oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Music & the Spoken Word - Mormon Tabernacle Choir radio program - Episode 759 Part 1 - 1944-01-30 - KSL - WLAC
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Syndicated radio broadcast of the Music & the Spoken Word radio program, originally broadcast from KSL (Salt Lake City, Utah). Recorded from Temple Square in Salt Lake City, Utah, the program is narrated by Richard L. Evans, conducted by J. Spencer Cornwall, and performed by the Mormon Tabernacle Choir with Alexander Schreiner on organ. This is the first part of the 759th airing, recorded on January 30, 1944. Part two: TR004032_2
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Mormon Tabernacle Choir; Alexander Schreiner
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (0:00) The Mormon Tabernacle Choir performs the opening theme / (0:41) Richard L. Evans announces the opening statements / (1:20) The Mormon Tabernacle Choir performs "Lo, My Shepherd is Divine," composed by Franz Joseph Haydn / (4:45) Richard L. Evans introduces the next performance / (4:54) Alexander Schreiner performs "We Thank Thee Lord, We Thank Thee" BWV 29, composed by Johann Sebastian Bach / (8:50) Richard L. Evans introduces the next performance / (9:10) The Mormon Tabernacle Choir performs Opus 4 number 3, composed by Sergei Rachmaninoff / (12:49) Richard L. Evans introduces the next performance / (12:58) Alexander Schreiner performs Adagio in Db, composed by Ludwig van Beethoven / (15:25) Richard L. Evans announced a reading [incomplete]
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: CBS Inc.; Mormon Tabernacle Choir; Music and the spoken word (Radio program); KSL (Radio station : Salt Lake City, Utah); WLAC (Radio station : Nashville, Tenn.)
